column1: Jahanabad is a town and a nagar panchayat in Pilibhit district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.
Town Jahanabad's major source of earning is agriculture.
Religion wise 98% of the total population is equally held by Hindus & Muslims and rest has been held by other religions like Sikhs
60% of the farmers of this town prefer cultivating the sugarcane crop
column2: other 30% prefer the crops of wheat and rice
column3: rest 10% are into other crops. Land is very fertile all around the town.

column1: Town Jahanabad is having major three connecting roads
1. Pilibhit-Bareilly Highway; 2. Pilibhit-Amariya Highway; 3. Jahanabad-Bahedi Highway.

The oldest market place of this town is known as 'Bazar-Katra' is available at main town road connecting to the town-police-station. Bazar-Katra is having a different variety of shops/stores to fulfill the basic needs of the town
This town is having Government managed Hospital & several clinic facilities

column2: this town had a well known landmark 'A Cinema Hall' named as 'Priya Video Talkiz'. Which is not working anymore.

column1: Jahanabad is a town and a nagar panchayat in Pilibhit district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.
As of the 2001 Census of India
column3: 420. Males constitute 53% of the population and females 47%. Jahanabad has an average literacy rate of 37%
column4: lower than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 46%
column5: and female literacy is 26%. In Jahanabad
column6: 19% of the population is under 6 years of age.
